name: Chris
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
February 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This AirBnb is a great option in Truckee. It's about 1 mile from the nearest restaurant/brewery (Fifty Fifty - with killer dark beers in particular) - so walkable-ish, but certainly close to town and Northstar if you're here to ski.
The unit was pristinely clean and comfortable and attractive. It is small, but more than enough for a couple. The bed was very comfortable, but the sheets are a terrycloth material that while very warm, may or may not be to everyone's liking.
Shower has good water pressure and get plenty hot enough quickly.
We cook several meals in during our vacations. The kitchen is equipped with what looked like bran- new Cuisinart nonstick cookware. Be aware however it is not stocked with certain basics you'll want if you're gonna cook much such as cooking oil, tin foil or ziplock bags, or more than a handful of coffee filters.
all in all, this is a fantastic option for a stay in the North Tahoe area - highly recommend

rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars

Â·

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We made a very quick decision to stay here for one night when 80 closed during the snowstorms. Her place is close to Truckee and the freeway and it felt better than driving back to Tahoe City where we still had our original place for a day. We were very grateful to find this spot. BJ was communicative and they plowed the driveway for our arrival. That said, they did not let us use their somewhat covered driveway and insisted we park where our car got covered with snow overnight and took a long time to clean in the morning. We had a baby with us and were stuck in a storm of the century and they showed no grace in a more extended checkout time (no one was getting anywhere) either. Also their bedroom was frigid. She claimed it never happens. They have three fans but no space heater. Her suggestion was turn up the fireplace and direct fans at the room. we had to put blankets on our infant and stay up all night making sure she didnâ€™t suffocate. There is also no dishwasher.

Perfect location for your ski trip as a couple or family with small kids.
Just enough kitchen to cook what you need but my only issue was the lack of microwavable dishes and mugs.
Otherwise it had everything we needed and was very clean and comfortable. A short walk to ski lodge and a great location to take a break for lunch or nap with younger kids learning to ski at Tahoe donner.
Short drive into Truckee for restaurants and summer activities as well.

name: David
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
March 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place had everything that other reviews described. Is perfect for beginner skiing at Tahoe Donner. My visit was 2 nights on the 3rd floor. Title says condos, but itâ€™s more like a studio apartment/hotel building with multiple units.
Here are a list of my pros and cons:
Proâ€™s
Nice view of lift
Competitive pricing
Quiet/warm/comfy (we stayed tues/weds)
Exit stairway made shorter access to lifts.
Kitchen: Hotplate, pan utensils, dish soap, replacement trash bags.
No weird smells, very clean!
Bathroom towels and bed sheets smelled very clean; huge square shower-head; hot/icy showers!
Comfy memory foam queen bed, feather down pillows but there are regular pillows in closet
Blackout drapes
Ice machine
Cons
No one at reception desk (although host Eric was very responsive)
GPS leaves you on the road, had trouble finding the lodge.
Grocery store is about 11 mins away
Toilet flushing weak, at one point had to plunge and refrain from flushing TP
Previous guests left food in freezer

name: Trupti
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Eric was great with his communication. The place was clean and for those who love skiing/snowboarding, the location is perfect! It's right by the base of the Tahoe Donner ski resort.
The room is great for 2 or max 3 people. We had a 2 night stay, and 3 of us - so it was quick but at the same time - comfortable. There's a fridge, microwave and a coffee -maker (make sure you carry your own coffee and filters) and a sink. Although there are lots of pots and pans - you can't cook anything as there is no cooking range or a hot plate for cooking.
The bathroom was clean, had good products. The bathtub is slightly tall to get in for short people (like me :) Plenty of towels, blankets and bedsheets and pillows.
We went here in winter - so there is a space heater and wall heater - not too sure if there is an air conditioner as well.
Overall a great find for a quick short stay!

review_text: Enjoyed our stay at the Powhaus. It was easy to find and easy to get in, the mobile app for the garage door was great. I enjoyed the fact that the garage was tall enough to fit my SUV with my Yakima roof rack on top. The place was very clean, and well designed, with a nice open living room and kitchen, great for hanging out with friends and family. The house was not too far from downtown Truckee, walkable for sure in the summer, but probably best to drive during the winter. The master bathroom had a wonderful soaking tub, perfect for after skiing. Easy to get to Northstar, which is where we skied this visit. Would come again!

There are great restaurants in downtown Truckee (walking distance when weather permits) and also a very short drive to Northstar and other resorts. It is spacious enough for our family of 4 or 6 (when grandparents joined). I also like the layout of the kids room with the bunk beds being downstairs and the kitchen and master bedroom upstairs. We look forward to staying again soon!!!

name: Miranda
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Our stay at the Palisades PowHaus was AMAZING to say the least. Aaron's home is thoughtfully designed and carefully curated for all travelers. First off all the home is almost brand new, in the guest book we only saw a few entries before us. Secondly, the place was SPARKLING clean - My friend and I are complete OCD Clean freaks and we didn't even feel the need to double clean when we arrived! We were 2 families traveling together with 3 kids (under 5) and we had a ton of fun and wished we had booked more nights. The home is equipped with all the latest technology and Aaron sends a full e-handbook about the home and location before your trip so you know what to expect. My fave is there is a thermostat for both the first and second floors so you can control the temp wherever you are. We spent time playing in the side-yard area where there was plenty of snow for the kids to enjoy. Many other resorts are and sledding areas are close by within 30minutes of driving as well. We happened to meet a few neighbors in the small townhome community and everyone was wonderful and kind to us as well. There are a few board games in the closet, the TV is equipped with all major video apps + surround sound for movie nights, and kitchen had everything we needed to cook multiple delicious meals and the dining table sat all of us and more. The master bath is to DIE for - the design in the home is so beautiful and modern. Shampoo, Conditioner, body wash, and lotion were all provided in small personal bottles like a hotel. Aaron was also super responsive and helpful throughout our stay and we had absolutely no issues at all. We will DEFINITELY be returning for another trip in the near future. Thank you so much Aaron!

What a perfect Truckee / Tahoe experience!! We had the best time in this incredible home and unbelievable location. Aaronâ€™s house is so tastefully done - feels/looks fresh in every corner & incredibly clean. We didnâ€™t want to leave.
We picked it for its quick access to all the ski resorts (which was amazing), but realized another star of the show is Truckee itself, and loved how we could walk down to town - please check out Moodyâ€™s for drinks / dinner!
Aaronâ€™s townhouse is in a very beautiful (seemingly brand new) small collection of homes and the drive was plowed & the surroundings are beautiful - remote feeling yet close to town.
We are particularly picky on beds, and the POW HAUS didnâ€™t disappoint - we slept great! Also loved the very well appointed kitchen & wonderfully helpful guidebook + the smart tech making check in & out a breeze.
This house is as comfortable/cozy as it is instgram-amable/stylish - highly recommend it for a group of friends or a family. Donâ€™tâ€™ miss the awesome deck & BBQ!

Aarons home was so thoughtfully decorated to have a mountain modern but still cozy cabin feel! Itâ€™s spacious not only in the rooms but has a beautiful family table to play games and eat around which is ideal for any family trip.
The location is easy to get to resorts in North Lake and itâ€™s walkable! There is a paved path that takes you right from the condo to the truckee river path and to a path to get downtown. There was snow but it was plowed which was a huge bonus. I cannot wait to come back during summer to rude our bikes!
Communication was great, kitchen has everything needed and the beds were comfortable. I travel a lot and would highly recommend this place.
Oh and I canâ€™t forget my favorite part of the entire place... there was a really cool neon sign in the garage that says â€œPOW HAUSâ€ above the ski rack. Perfect Instagram for my ski trip if Iâ€™m being honest!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had such a great time at Palisades PowHaus. The location is ideal for both frequent Tahoe travelers and visitors from afar since it's really easy to get to off the highway and its close proximity to all that Tahoe has to offer: top notch ski resorts, downtown Truckee, hiking trails, parks, golf courses, and more. The check-in process was seamless and Aaron is very responsive and communicative, though we didn't really have to contact him as everything worked great!
The house itself is even better than the photos! Plenty of room for a large group or family but still feels cozy enough that it give you an authentic Tahoe cabin feel. It felt much more like a home than your typical Airbnb listing with comfortable furnishing and all the modern amenities you would want. The kitchen was well stocked with everything you need since we cooked all our meals during our stay there. The garage can fit two cars and has an outlet for EV charging and space to store your gear. All the bedrooms have large windows and a lot of privacy with views into the woods. There's also a generous amount of outdoor space with room to grill and hang out.
If you're looking at this listing and thinking about booking, rest assured you'll make the right decision! It was one of the best weekends I've had in a while!

review_text:
The place was pretty nice. It had beautiful views and was what we expected. The kitchen was well stocked with nice little extras.
Unfortunately, for us, there were some cleanliness issues in the bathroom. The worst was the moldy shower curtain, top of the tub and hairs on the shower walls. I have a mold sensitivity, and thankfully I didn't become ill. The floors were also cold accept near the bathroom. Guessing all the cracks in the floor is a sign the floor heating needs repair? The place was warm overall though.
The check out instructions were contradictory between the book vs wall sign. The book was more lax, but the wall sign gave instructions to basically clean the place. We were expected to remove bedding and towels and put them in a pile, take out trash/recycling and open all windows. Worst of all was the expectation for us to wash our dishes by hand and put them away. These expectations would have been acceptable had it not been for the $150 cleaning fee.

However, Christine's response and support was amazing. She was very responsive and kind, providing us with a new key early the next morning, allowing us to continue enjoying our vacation without stress.
We will definitely stay in this place the next time we visit Truckee, highly recommended!

Delightful, cozy and comfortable. I loved the patio overlooking the Truckee River and even slept with the sliding door partially open so I could hear the river at night. The unit is very well designed and has everything you need for preparing simple meals. Plus there are lots of restaurants in Truckee. Some guests have complained about the sofa bed, and while I did not find it very comfortable for side sleeping, it was fine if I was sleeping on my back or stomach. I slept soundly and did not wake up with hip or back pain as I sometimes do at home, so I give it a thumbs up! You do hear the trains, but I did not find them intrusive.
Christine and Paul were so friendly and helpful. I thank them for a wonderful stay!

The place is well situated on the picturesque Truckee River. We stayed in mid September so it was a nice surprise to find the heated floors on as the mornings can be a little chilly. The sofa bed was too firm for us (which I knew based on the reviews) so we decided to put the two twin size beds found in the loft together and make one large comfy bed. The entire neighborhood is very peaceful never say the owner but one friendly neighbor and his adorable dogs. My only drawback was the trains at night, the 1st night (Thursday) I heard it 5 times, seconds night 3 times and by the night 3rd time I didnâ€™t hear it at all, I guess you just get used to the noise. Even with that being said I would definitely stay here again and highly recommended.

This is just what I needed before a two week work assignment. I was able to really relax whether it was sitting out on the back porch or looking at the river through the window. My partner said it was like living in a screensaver image with one of those beautiful pictures of nature.
The place was really modern and was fine for two people. We were really impressed by the kitchen appliances. There is a high quality induction stove and toaster oven that I don't remember mentioned in the description. It allowed us to cook food when we wanted.
This is the kind of place you can leave the car parked during your entire stay and walk everywhere, including a nice park across the river. We also saw lots of wildlife like beaver, coyote, and lots of birds.
I hope to make this a longer term stay on our next visit!

I highly recommend this home to anyone who is looking for a relaxing place to recharge during the exploration of the Lake Tahoe area.

As others have mentioned, the sofa bed is very uncomfortable, so I climbed up to the loft and slept on one of the plush twin mattresses. I wish we had brought our mattress topper. I would suggest bringing an eye mask if you wake up with the sun because the shades do not make the room dark.

name: Jeff
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
So many wonderful aspects about this place! Location and walkability to downtown, the river, very clean and tidy, tastefully done build right in keeping with the style of Truckee and a nice focus on recycled/repurposed woodwork! The hydronic floors are lovely heat!
The bed is as difficult or possibly worse than I had imagined! I could not sleep without getting sore every so often! If you are a flat back or stomach sleeper and spread the weight of your body out you may be ok. I like to sleep on my sides too and that was like sleeping on a concrete slab with a few layers of cardboard and a blanket! No give, no cushion, and for us, little good shuteye!
If you, as we did, prioritize other aspects of a worthwhile stay ( location, style, price etc) maybe consider bringing a mattress topper to make the bed more comfy? Seems crazy to pay so much and not get at least a somewhat comfortable bed!
The upstairs twin beds are comfy but tight on headroom, and you need to climb a ladder to ascend or descend. And they are twins!
Also, no stovetop in the house! Microwave and BBQ outside only! These two things alone (bed and no cooking) make this choice a tough one to consider again!
A simple mattress topper would make it a strong contender though!
My take is that they are doing everything to discourage couples from enjoying any cuddle time! And yup, it worked!
This was also my first ever Airbnb where the price breakdown ended up costing more for the cleaning portion of the rental than the actual rental!! So many great things about it but, unfortunately, some critically unappealing features as well!
Donâ€™t skim past the bed reviews!

When we arrived, two doors were wide open â€” not even the screens were closed. This led to all of us being bitten by mosquitoes while inside the house for the rest of the stay. 2 people in our party had giant moths fly onto their faces while trying to fall asleep, and there were a number of large ants wandering near the doors that had been left open.
WiFi only worked for an hour out of our entire stay. Host did not offer assistance in fixing it. Right before we left we fixed it for her. (More complicated than simple reboot, used our time/energy.)
Hot tub was unusable, slimy and sludgy. Host didnâ€™t let us know maintenance would be performed while we were there, surprising us and the hot tub maintenance worker. We couldnâ€™t use the bathroom for hours because it was used to fill the hot tub. Felt bad for the worker; it took him a long time to scrub the tub out.

The location was also perfect for us, as it was just a short drive away from some of the best ski resorts in the area. The cabin was also close to downtown Truckee, where we enjoyed exploring the local shops and restaurants.
One of our favorite things about the cabin was that we could bring our pups, which made our stay that much better. There was also a hot tub which was a perfect place to relax after a long day on the slopes. The views from the cabin were also good.
The host was also incredibly friendly and accommodating, providing us with all the information we needed to make our stay as comfortable as possible.

This was a comfy stay. There is no cable TV which we take as a good thing. If you need, bring an HDMI cable to connect to your laptop or iPad.
Internet worked well. The only problem we had was when the power went out for a couple hours the morning we were checking out. Thankfully we were able to manually pull the garage door open to get the truck out.
There was still coffee grinds in the coffee maker and not fully cleaned dishes in the cabinets, so just be sure to give your dishes a good wash before you use them.
Most of the outlets in the master bedroom donâ€™t work, I think one does and the light switch doesnâ€™t work.
The overall layout upstairs was nice and open. We had a 17 mos old and 2.5 year old running all over the place.
Coffee and spices are provided with cooking oil. The cookware is great.
Location is stellar and the drive in and drive way isnâ€™t steep so no worries when there is snow.
Loved the chess set. Random I know but it brought back some childhood memories of play.
Check in was a bit on the late side at 4pm. Checkout was 11am which was better than most early checkouts, definitely appreciated that.

review_text: We loved staying here. It was the perfect cozy place to take a mental break from the crazy busy city life. Robert was very quick answering all emails/messages. Instructions getting there were pretty clear. We did have trouble trying to find the key lock, but I missed checking messages with updated instructions. The minute we entered it smelled a bit like Clorox, definitely was clean. The boys got very comfortable on the couch where we had movie nights. Kitchen had mostly what it needs. Pots were great but pans need to be replace. Stove is functional yet the oven needed a huge cleaning so we couldnâ€™t bake anything/frozen pizza or bread. The bunk room was perfect for the kids. Loft stairs are a bit steep, but the loft looked perfect. It was a bit dusty and some dog hair but honestly I didnâ€™t mind. It does get toasty. The place was newly remodeled and clean and functional. Only difficulty was the thermostat is old and the arrow that indicates temperature set had broken off, so you couldn't tell what temp it was set to, and the on/off switch was also kind of broken. It gets very hot up in the loft if the heat is too high, so that was a bit tricky to deal with. Robert's communication was great and he obviously cares about the home and guests a lot, so I imagine that little glitch will be remedied soon. Overall delightful and cozy cabin.

There is everything you need for cooking, you'll just need to bring your own storage containers if you want to take your leftovers home. The upgrades made around the cabin are very nice! You do have to park on the road and walk down a stairway to get to the cabin, so be mindful about how much you pack Overall this was a great cabin for our little weekend get away!

review_text: This cabin is a great getaway for you and your family. All amenities are provided, which made it even better! One thing to keep in mind are the stairs inside the cabin. They are a bit too steep, so if you plan on bringing a dog, there is a probability that they will not be able to climb up to the second floor. Possibly might have to carry your dog upstairs. In addition, There are no curtains in the living room and there is only one heater in the entire house, which is compatible. 24 hour store is just 6 minutes away from the cabin and there is a very nice hike over at Donner Memorial State Park. Overall, this cabin was very clean and the environment was super quiet! Robert was an amazing host! For sure, looking forward to coming back!

review_text:
Robert was a very responsive, friendly and accommodating host.
The house itself offers good value: Itâ€™s a cute little house on a pretty spacious property that was more than enough for my wife and I and our small dog. Would def still be comfortable with a blowup bed for a second couple downstairs (we saw it said a floor mattress in the common area but didnâ€™t see one). Theres a really nice deck around the house that I sat on and read in the mornings and relaxed in the eveningsâ€”and despite being next to the freeway it was pretty peaceful and quiet. And plus, youâ€™re a 15-25 minute walk to a ton of great trails around Donner if you really want to get away away. The beach at Donner Lake is a 2 minute drive away. Thereâ€™s a nice big backyard down below with a great picnic table we ate breakfasts at (a neighbors dogs even came over to say hi!).
Amenities inside were updated. Nice kitchen with enough cooking tools and essentials. Updated bathroom. Comfortable living room and a nice sized TV.
Compared to a lot of other options i looked at in the area, I liked that thereâ€™s a nice two car parking space up front that can fit a car and a boat. Weâ€™d def consider coming back here with our boat.
As an aside, stairs were steeper and narrower than they looked, just a consideration for people with knee issues. Our small dog could not go up and down those stairs. But not a problem, we just carried her!
Overall a really good value and would recommend to others.

name: Martin
rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
Â·
February 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
In stark contrast to many previous travelers reviews, we found this place rather unwelcoming. The proximity to I-80 is remarkable with constant background noise and some view of passing trucks above while cooking.
There is no privacy (no blinds and shutters) in the main living area and the furniture could use an upgrade. Lights are dim making it difficult to read a book after sunset.
Some basic kitchen supplies mentioned on the website could not be found. Some descriptions on the web did not match reality including triple bunk bed size that is way smaller, so be aware when coming with kids.
In our case, there were no instructions (!) on how to operate the place, let alone recommendations on what to do in the neighborhood, town and resorts.
The sleeping area on the balcony is comfortable and the shower is clean and relaxing. After figuring out how to do it, the heating warms the place pretty well.
In summary, this basic hut maybe best for avid skiers who leave early and come back at night to sleep and watch a movie.
However, if your vacation includes an idea of being able to move freely, relax, and spending time to read and cook, I strongly recommend looking elsewhere.

Robert's tiny cabin is the perfect escape in Truckee. I typically ski over at Sugarbowl, so staying in Truckee is a nice short trip in the morning up to the mountain.
Robert has done an amazing job renovating this old little cabin and adding in nice new amenities with a highly functional kitchen and bathroom. He had a french press, pots and pans, cast iron skillets, and everything you need to cook meals. The hot water tank was a new, energy efficient model, which means you can do dishes and take a shower without running out (I've lived in places without that!). It was absolutely spotless and very very clean when we came in, easing my mind about our stay during COVID-19.
I'll definitely be back again soon!

That entrance is completely separate so not a major issue, but if you need to access the washer/dryer itâ€™s in the garage so you may bump into them since they access their unit from the garage.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
The place was exactly as described. Instructions for checking in and out were clear and Martin was responsive with online messages as well as by phone. He was nice enough to offer another night due to weather conditions. We didn't have to worry about clearing the snow from the driveway as his neighbor across the street cleared the driveway for us not once, but twice in the morning due to heavy snow fall. Nothing was broken and everything was in working order.
To find something to improve on, I'd have to say the kitchen didn't have some items we were expecting it to have (baking sheet for the oven, large mixing bowl, steak knives, etc), but not too big of a deal as we made do and needing these items depends on what you're cooking. We had 5 children with us and some board games would have been nice, but again not a big deal as the TV had plenty of options for things to watch and outdoor play during the heavy snow fall was fun for them.
Overall, our stay was good.

The place is close enough to Lake Tahoe and Donner Lake to serve as a base for visiting those attractions. The listing accurately described it as a good option for WFH away from the big city. It is in a quite residential neighborhood and we liked it The place is large and clean. It has the essentials for cooking a good meal, though some cookware, dinnerware, utensils, and sitting furniture can use some updates. Unlike a hotel room or an AirBnB place that is exclusively used for rentals, someone actually lives in this as home when it isnâ€™t rented. It comes with the feel of a home and the big and small things come with a regular home. For that, we appreciate Martinâ€™s hospitality.

Overall, everything was great at this Airbnb. Well decorated and clean. Toiletries provided were high quality. Hot tub was perfect and clean towels by the patio door was a nice touch.
My only complaint is upon leaving we checked the house book to make sure we turned the thermostat down to whatever the owners preferred and in the house book there was a list of checkout instructions, 3 of which included:
â€¢ Load all dirty dishes into dishwasher (START THEM)
â€¢ Bag and remove all trash from the home and place them in the bear box.
â€¢ Put dirty towels in the washer (start the washer)
I specifically do not book Airbnbs that include in their listing that I will need to do housework. I also wouldnâ€™t expect an Airbnb that charged me a $325 cleaning fee to include these rules to be discovered right as we are leaving.
I hope Airbnb owners will get away from this practice of surprising their renters with housework. Just charge the appropriate cleaning fee and let your cleaning crew handle it.

We taught our niece how to ski at Tahoe Donner - such a great little hill for beginners.
We celebrated St Patrick's Day in the house and brought corned beef from home but completely forgot the slow cooker we had planned to pack. I was ready to run into town to buy one but the house had the perfect sized in the cupboard! All in all, it was an awesome little escape! :) Definitely would stay again!

The garage was great to back our truck into and two other cars fit in the driveway.
Everything was immaculate and the decor aesthetically pleasing .
The 5pm check in time was a little late for us but we made it work and there is absolutely zero heat in the master bedroom and only a teeny sliver of heat in the master bathroom . The rest of the house was fine as far as heat and we ended up finding some space heaters in the house so we had those running in the master bedroom which worked great.
We loved how we could see the snow all around us like the house was in its own snow globe! The location is fantastic!
We never used the hot tub and gym thatâ€™s included as itâ€™s 2 miles away and $17 per person per day per the gym when I called .

name: Sean
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
January 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Value: for the reduced $451 a night compared to $600ish was a good deal given how modern the renovations make the property and its location and the time in season.
Home: nice place, renovations have made it very appealing. Some examples of its age linger like few PowerPoints in rooms and large glass windows that allow in cold mainly in the master bedroom. Overall would stay there again.
VRA: Person using Airbnb chat was friendly at first and easy to talk to but over time discussions became uncomfortable. VRA 24/7 hotline was pointless and likely is more intended to give owners peace of mind then to give tenants quality service. Overall would not stay with VRA again.
Warning: property has large glass windows in the master bedroom which offer great views during the daylight but allow cold to transfer in at night. I have photo evidence of the temps up to 10F difference even with the furnace running, space heater and a electric fireplace running. We had a baby and were forced to leave

We really enjoyed our stay. The location couldn't have been better, especially for avid skiers like us. The house was close Sugarbowl and Northstar ski resorts. The garage was also tall and could fit an SUV with ski racks.
The layout of the house was great, with the bedrooms located upstairs. This was perfect for our group, as some of us are early risers and could easily prepare breakfast or chat downstairs without disturbing those still upstairs.
The only downside was the noise from the nearby train that passed through the city of Truckee. It's something to consider if you're a light sleeper or have young children (we didn't have a problem).

review_text: Iâ€™d started to lose faith in Air BnB places and then we stayed here. It is, by far, the nicest place weâ€™ve ever rented. Ever. Not only is the description on point, even when describing the potential negatives, like noise from the train, the photos are actually accurate and do it justice. It was genuinely spotless, and we felt very at home because of thoughtful details like throw blankets in the living room, Qtips in the bathroom, and 100% cotton sheets. After a long day of travel, I could have cried when I slipped in to bed and felt not only a heavy down-filled duvet, but silky soft cotton sheets. No slippery, sweat-producing polyester. The decor was tasteful and unique, not like an IKEA display room, but like something Iâ€™d like to see in my own home. Truly, the only thing I think that needs to be added to the home is a hammock on the grassy backyard so you can nap and listen to the Truckee River. A wonderful place to stay, indeed.

review_text: Yvette's cabin by the Truckee river is a little slice of heaven! Seriously! This is a historic and recently completely updated house only a block from the downtown main street. A mile the other way is an entrance to the Truckee River trail which is a great place to walk at any time of year. The house was so cozy and really really perfect. Specifically- There is a 2 person bedroom (one bed) and bath on the main floor, so it is easy for those of us at a certain age. A large bed downstairs worked well for my 6' 5" adult son. The kitchen has everything we needed and we cooked at home most nights. I love to cook and was happy that there are measuring cups, cheese graters, and really everything I needed. The living room is cozy with a great deck and view of the river. The TV is huge which my hubby liked. In addition, the whole home was super clean! There was absolutely nothing lacking, and I really appreciate Yvette and her husband for making this such a treat! A+++++++++++++++
